title: How to write an invitation letter to someone to invite him to our office for casual meeting - Quora

response.answer_text: All invitations depend on how well you know the person, or the purpose of the visit. Since you said this was a casual meeting, I'm assuming you know the person fairly well too. So you could say something like ‘I was hoping you could make it to our office on so-and-so date so that we could catch up (or the reason for the meeting). Let me know if you can make it.’ You could end it with something like ‘Looking forward to seeing you.’
